body:
**Actionable comments posted: 2**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In `@opc/scripts/core/store_learning.py`: - Around line 123-134: The primary provider exception is being swallowed during the EmbeddingService embed call; modify the try/except around EmbeddingService(provider=embedding_provider) and await embed(content) to capture the exception as e and log it before attempting the local fallback (e.g., logger.error("Embedding with %s failed, falling back to local", embedding_provider, exc_info=e) or use logging.getLogger(__name__).exception), then proceed to instantiate EmbeddingService(provider="local") and await embed(content) as currently done; key symbols: EmbeddingService, embedding_provider, embed(content), embedding. ```
üßπ Nitpick comments (3)
opc/pyproject.toml (1)
`44-48`: **Reconcile duplicate optional dependencies.** The `embeddings` optional group now duplicates `sentence-transformers` and `torch` from main dependencies but with lower version constraints (`>=2.0.0`). Consider either: 1. Removing the optional group if these are now always required, or 2. Keeping them only in the optional group if the fallback should remain opt-in
‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested fix if fallback should remain opt-in ```diff dependencies = [ ... "redis>=7.1.0", - "sentence-transformers>=5.2.0", - "torch>=2.9.1", ] ``` Keep dependencies in the optional `embeddings` group and handle `ImportError` gracefully in the fallback code.
opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py (1)
`542-553`: **Consider concurrent embedding for better performance.** Sequential processing is correct, but for large batches this could be slow. Consider using `asyncio.gather` for concurrent requests if Ollama server can handle parallel requests.
‚ôªÔ∏è Optional: Concurrent batch processing ```diff async def embed_batch(self, texts: list[str]) -> list[list[float]]: - return [await self.embed(text) for text in texts] + if not texts: + return [] + return await asyncio.gather(*[self.embed(text) for text in texts]) ```
opc/scripts/core/store_learning.py (1)
`260-262`: **Consider applying consistent provider logic to legacy function.** The legacy `store_learning` function still hardcodes `provider="local"` while `store_learning_v2` uses the configurable provider with fallback. If the Ollama provider becomes standard, consider updating this function for consistency, or document why it intentionally differs.
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Path: .coderabbit.yaml **Review profile**: CHILL **Plan**: Pro
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between 2e2e2cf81db9df95c2147c7f2c3eda6dea45976e and e4d51297901c08fe375285c46927fcf630ce91fc.

üß∞ Additional context used
üß¨ Code graph analysis (1)
opc/scripts/core/store_learning.py (1)
opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py (8) * `EmbeddingService` (561-746) * `embed` (53-55) * `embed` (118-131) * `embed` (266-269) * `embed` (385-393) * `embed` (440-462) * `embed` (521-540) * `embed` (647-668)
üîá Additional comments (5)
.coderabbit.yaml (1)
`1-44`: **Configuration looks valid.** The CodeRabbit configuration file is well-structured and follows the schema correctly. Key settings: - Auto-review enabled on `main` branch (excluding drafts) - Chill profile for less strict reviews - Sensible path exclusions for generated/lock files - Poems disabled for cleaner output
opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py (3)
`481-501`: **LGTM - Model configuration is reasonable.** The model dimension mapping provides sensible defaults. Note that `bge-large` and `bge-m3` in the `MODELS` dict aren't mentioned in the docstring, but this is a minor documentation inconsistency. --- `503-519`: **LGTM - Constructor handles configuration well.** Good defensive approach with the dimension fallback to 768 for unknown models, and flexible host configuration via environment variable. --- `640-643`: **LGTM - Integration follows established patterns.** The Ollama provider integration is consistent with how other providers (local, voyage) are initialized in the service.
opc/pyproject.toml (1)
`36-37`: The dependency versions specified are valid. `sentence-transformers` 5.2.0 and `torch` 2.9.1 are the current latest stable versions on PyPI as of January 2026. Installation will succeed with these version constraints‚Äîno action needed on versions. > Likely an incorrect or invalid review comment.
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can disable this entire section by setting `review_details` to `false` in your review settings.

**Actionable comments posted: 2**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In `@opc/pyproject.toml`: - Around line 36-37: The pyproject shows duplicate dependencies: core requires "sentence-transformers>=5.2.0" and "torch>=2.9.1" while the optional [embeddings] group also lists "sentence-transformers>=2.0.0" and "torch>=2.0.0"; remove the redundant [embeddings] optional dependency group (or if optional install is truly desired, remove those two packages from the [embeddings] extras and leave only embeddings-specific extras) so the packages only appear in core; update or delete the [embeddings] extras block accordingly and ensure only one authoritative version of sentence-transformers and torch remains. In `@opc/scripts/core/store_learning.py`: - Around line 126-141: The EmbeddingService instances created in the embedding block (EmbeddingService(provider=embedding_provider) and the fallback EmbeddingService(provider="local")) are never closed; ensure you properly close their underlying httpx.AsyncClient by either using an async context manager (`async with EmbeddingService(...) as embedder`) around each creation or calling `await embedder.aclose()` in a finally block for both the primary and fallback embedder paths so the client is always cleaned up regardless of success or exception. ```
üßπ Nitpick comments (2)
opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py (1)
`650-653`: **Consider forwarding additional kwargs to OllamaEmbeddingProvider.** The `OllamaEmbeddingProvider` constructor accepts `timeout` and `verify_ssl` parameters, but these aren't being forwarded from kwargs. For consistency with how other providers handle configuration, consider passing these through.
‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested improvement ```diff elif provider == "ollama": ollama_model = model if model is not None else OllamaEmbeddingProvider.DEFAULT_MODEL ollama_host = kwargs.get("host", None) - self._provider = OllamaEmbeddingProvider(model=ollama_model, host=ollama_host) + self._provider = OllamaEmbeddingProvider( + model=ollama_model, + host=ollama_host, + timeout=kwargs.get("timeout", 30.0), + verify_ssl=kwargs.get("verify_ssl", True), + ) ```
opc/scripts/core/store_learning.py (1)
`43-49`: **Import ordering: logger initialization should follow all imports.** The logger initialization is placed between import statements. PEP 8 style recommends keeping all imports together, with module-level code following imports.
‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested reordering ```diff import logging import os import sys from datetime import datetime, timezone - -logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) from pathlib import Path from dotenv import load_dotenv + +logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) ```

.coderabbit.yaml (1)
`1-44`: **LGTM!** The CodeRabbit configuration is well-structured and all settings conform to the schema. The path filters appropriately exclude generated files (minified JS, lock files, dist directories), and the "chill" profile is a reasonable choice for less strict reviews.
opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py (1)
`481-569`: **LGTM - Previous SSL and client reuse concerns addressed.** The `OllamaEmbeddingProvider` implementation correctly: - Uses a persistent `httpx.AsyncClient` for connection reuse - Accepts `verify_ssl` parameter with secure default (`True`) - Provides proper `aclose()` for resource cleanup - Validates the embedding response field The sequential batch processing is documented and acceptable given Ollama's API limitations.
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can disable this entire section by setting `review_details` to `false` in your review settings.

**Actionable comments posted: 1**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In `@opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py`: - Around line 380-404: The prompt_embedding_config() flow doesn't collect or guide users about API keys for the "openai" and "voyage" providers; update prompt_embedding_config() to, when provider == "openai" or provider == "voyage", either (a) call or reuse prompt_api_keys() to prompt for OPENAI_API_KEY and VOYAGE_API_KEY and store them into the returned config (e.g., config["OPENAI_API_KEY"], config["VOYAGE_API_KEY"]) or (b) display a clear console note telling users to export the required env var (OPENAI_API_KEY or VOYAGE_API_KEY) and optionally offer to open an interactive prompt to enter the key to persist into config; ensure the unique symbols prompt_embedding_config() and prompt_api_keys() are referenced/linked so keys are actually captured and returned in the config dict for later use. ```
üßπ Nitpick comments (2)
opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py (2)
`630-630`: **Remove extraneous `f` prefix from string literal.** This f-string has no placeholders, so the `f` prefix is unnecessary. Per static analysis (Ruff F541).
Suggested fix ```diff - console.print(f"\n[bold]Step 6/13: Container Stack (Sandbox Infrastructure)[/bold]") + console.print("\n[bold]Step 6/13: Container Stack (Sandbox Infrastructure)[/bold]") ```
--- `628-628`: **Stale comment: step number doesn't match console output.** The comment says "Step 5" but the console prints "Step 6/13". This mismatch also occurs in subsequent step comments (lines 657, 670, 781, 840, 991, 1029). Consider updating these comments to match the new 13-step numbering, or removing them since the `console.print` already documents the step number.

üîá Additional comments (2)
opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py (2)
`478-489`: **LGTM!** The embedding configuration is correctly written to the `.env` file, with conditional Ollama-specific variables only when that provider is selected. --- `607-623`: **LGTM!** The embedding configuration step is well-integrated into the wizard flow with a sensible default fallback to `local` provider.
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can disable this entire section by setting `review_details` to `false` in your review settings.

**Actionable comments posted: 1** > [!CAUTION] > Some comments are outside the diff and can‚Äôt be posted inline due to platform limitations. > > > >
> ‚ö†Ô∏è Outside diff range comments (2)
> >
> opc/scripts/core/store_learning.py (2)
> > `117-181`: **Resource leak: `embedder` not closed on exception paths.** > > The `aclose()` calls at lines 134 and 169 handle the success/duplicate paths, but if an exception occurs during embedding generation (line 125), dedup search (line 129), or storage (line 163), the embedder's HTTP client is never closed. The exception handler at line 180 doesn't clean up. > > >
> üîí Recommended fix using try/finally > > ```diff > try: > memory = await create_memory_service( > backend=backend, > session_id=session_id, > ) > > # Generate embedding > embedder = EmbeddingService(provider=os.getenv("EMBEDDING_PROVIDER", "local")) > - embedding = await embedder.embed(content) > - > - # Deduplication check: search for similar existing memories > try: > - existing = await memory.search_vector(embedding, limit=1) > - if existing and len(existing) > 0: > - top_match = existing[0] > - similarity = top_match.get("similarity", 0) > - if similarity >= DEDUP_THRESHOLD: > - await embedder.aclose() > - await memory.close() > - return { > - "success": True, > - "skipped": True, > - "reason": f"duplicate (similarity: {similarity:.2f})", > - "existing_id": top_match.get("id"), > - } > - except Exception: > - # If search fails, proceed with storing (don't block on dedup errors) > - pass > + embedding = await embedder.embed(content) > + > + # Deduplication check: search for similar existing memories > + try: > + existing = await memory.search_vector(embedding, limit=1) > + if existing and len(existing) > 0: > + top_match = existing[0] > + similarity = top_match.get("similarity", 0) > + if similarity >= DEDUP_THRESHOLD: > + await memory.close() > + return { > + "success": True, > + "skipped": True, > + "reason": f"duplicate (similarity: {similarity:.2f})", > + "existing_id": top_match.get("id"), > + } > + except Exception: > + # If search fails, proceed with storing (don't block on dedup errors) > + pass > # ... rest of the function ... > + finally: > + await embedder.aclose() > ``` > > Alternatively, use the async context manager pattern as suggested in the previous review: > ```python > async with EmbeddingService(provider=os.getenv("EMBEDDING_PROVIDER", "local")) as embedder: > embedding = await embedder.embed(content) > # ... rest of the logic > ``` >
> > --- > > `247-276`: **Same resource leak issue in `store_learning`.** > > The `store_learning` function has the same issue‚Äîif an exception occurs between lines 255-263, the embedder's HTTP client leaks. Apply the same try/finally or context manager pattern here. > >
> >
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @.coderabbit.yaml: - Around line 24-25: The comment for the configuration key request_changes_workflow is misleading: it reads "Request changes on critical issues" while the value is false (which disables that behavior); update the comment to accurately reflect the current setting (for example change it to "Disable request changes workflow" or similar) or, if the intended behavior was to enable requests, flip the boolean to true; reference the request_changes_workflow key to locate and adjust the comment or value accordingly. ```
‚ôªÔ∏è Duplicate comments (2)
opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py (2)
`457-457`: **Security: `verify=False` disables SSL certificate verification.** This allows MITM attacks if `OLLAMA_HOST` points to a remote server. While acceptable for local development (`localhost`), it's risky for remote deployments. Consider making SSL verification configurable or defaulting to `verify=True` with a documented override for self-signed certificates. --- `418-479`: **Missing `aclose()` method causes resource leak.** `OllamaEmbeddingProvider` creates a persistent `httpx.AsyncClient` at line 457, but unlike `OpenAIEmbeddingProvider` and `VoyageEmbeddingProvider`, it lacks an `aclose()` method. Since `EmbeddingService.aclose()` (line 720) checks `hasattr(self._provider, "aclose")`, the Ollama client will never be closed.
üêõ Proposed fix ```diff `@property` def dimension(self) -> int: """Return model dimension.""" return self._dimension + + async def aclose(self) -> None: + """Close the HTTP client.""" + await self._client.aclose() + + async def __aenter__(self) -> "OllamaEmbeddingProvider": + """Enter async context manager.""" + return self + + async def __aexit__(self, *args) -> None: + """Exit async context manager and close client.""" + await self.aclose() ```
üßπ Nitpick comments (1)
opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py (1)
`460-465`: **Add defensive check for missing embedding in response.** If Ollama returns a malformed response without the `"embedding"` key, line 465 raises an unclear `KeyError`. Other providers validate the response structure.
‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested improvement ```diff async def embed(self, text: str) -> list[float]: """Generate embedding for a single text.""" url = f"{self.host.rstrip('/')}/api/embeddings" response = await self._client.post(url, json={"model": self.model, "prompt": text}) response.raise_for_status() - return response.json()["embedding"] + data = response.json() + embedding = data.get("embedding") + if embedding is None: + raise EmbeddingError(f"Ollama response missing 'embedding' field: {data}") + return embedding ```

üîá Additional comments (6)
.coderabbit.yaml (1)
`1-44`: **Configuration validates against schema and follows good practices.** The CodeRabbit configuration is well-structured with appropriate settings: - Path filters correctly exclude generated/vendored files (minified JS, lock files, dist directories) - "Chill" profile aligns with the PR review preference - Sensible defaults for summary generation and walkthrough collapse One minor note: `base_branches: [main]` may be redundant if `main` is already the default branch, as auto-review is enabled by default for the default branch.
opc/pyproject.toml (1)
`44-47`: **LGTM!** The cleanup is appropriate‚Äîmoving `sentence-transformers` and `torch` to main dependencies and leaving the `embeddings` group empty with a backward-compatibility comment is a clean approach. This aligns with the PR objective of ensuring the local embedding provider works out of the box.
opc/scripts/core/db/embedding_service.py (1)
`623-626`: **LGTM!** The Ollama provider integration follows the same pattern as other providers, correctly passing through `model` and `host` kwargs while allowing environment variable defaults in `OllamaEmbeddingProvider`.
opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py (3)
`380-417`: **LGTM!** The `prompt_embedding_config()` function properly handles all four embedding providers with appropriate prompts. API keys are collected securely using `password=True`, and helpful warnings are displayed when keys aren't provided. This addresses the previous review feedback about missing API key guidance. --- `492-515`: **LGTM!** The environment file generation correctly serializes all embedding provider configurations, with helpful commented placeholders when API keys aren't provided during setup. --- `633-649`: **LGTM!** The embedding configuration step is well-integrated into the wizard flow. The default of `{"provider": "local"}` when skipped aligns with the runtime default in `store_learning.py`.
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can disable this entire section by setting `review_details` to `false` in your review settings.
